citation.article-title: Halomonas xinjiangensis sp. nov., a halotolerant bacterium isolated from a salt lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Halomonas xinjiangensis sp. nov.
Halomonas xinjiangensis (xin.ji.ang.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. xinjiangensis pertaining to Xinjiang, a region of China, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, motile by means of peritrichous flagella and rod-shaped, approximately 1.2–2.0×0.6–1.0 μm in size (Supplementary Fig. S2).
Colonies on TSA medium are 1–2 mm in diameter, smooth, circular and brown–orange after 5 days.
Growth occurs at 15–50 °C and pH 6.0–9.0, with optimum growth at 37 °C and pH 7.0.
Grows in 0–20 % (w/v) NaCl, with optimum growth at 10–13 % (w/v) NaCl.
Metabolism is respiratory with oxygen as terminal electron acceptor.
Does not grow anaerobically in the presence of nitrate, nitrite or fumarate.
Oxidase-negative and catalase-positive.
Phosphatase is produced, but not exopolysaccharide or poly-β-hydroxyalkanoate.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Selenite is reduced.
Aesculin and Tweens 20 and 80 are hydrolysed, but casein, DNA, gelatin, starch and urea are not.
H2S is formed from l-cysteine.
Positive for gluconate oxidation.

Negative for lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, phenylalanine deamination, indole production, the methyl red and Voges–Proskauer tests, o-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranosidase and fermentation of glucose.

Utilizes l-rhamnose, d-mannose, d-fructose, d-galactose, trehalose, aesculin, xanthine, l-asparagine, l-serine and hypoxanthine as sole sources of carbon, nitrogen (where appropriate) and energy, but not d-mannitol, maltose, d-sorbitol, cellobiose, d-ribose, d-xylose, myo-inositol, lactose, raffinose, d-salicin, arabinose, xylitol, dulcitol, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-lysine or l-arginine.
Acid is produced from d-ribose, d- and l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, cellobiose, maltose, trehalose, d- and l-fucose.

Acid is produced weakly from aesculin, but not from erythritol, d-adonitol, glycerol, l-xylose, d-fructose, l-sorbose, methyl β-d-xyloside, dulcitol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, d-glucose, d-sorbitol, d-lactose, arbutin, salicin, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, gentiobiose, xylitol, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose or d- or l-arabitol.

Susceptible to streptomycin (10 μg), amoxicillin (25 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), cefoxitin (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), nitrofurantoin (300 μg), ampicillin (10 μg), sulfamide (250 μg), cefotaxime (30 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), polymyxin B (300 IU), rifampicin (30 μg) and carbenicillin (100 μg), but not to tobramycin (10 μg) or trimethoprim/sulfametoxazole (1.25/23.75 μg).
The predominant ubiquinone is Q-9.
The major fatty acids (greater than 5 %) are C18 : 1ω7c, C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c, C16 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c/C16 : 1ω6c.
The type strain is TRM 0175T (=CCTCC AB 208329T =KCTC 22608T), isolated from a hypersaline soil sample from Xinjiang Province, north-west China.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.0 mol%.
